resume.title: Jack Hoyt
resume.objectives: My goal is to gain more practical knowledge and contribute in a team of software or mobile application developers.this language looks a lot different than your fellow group members (especially use of "my" here

job.job_title: Mobile Application Development Intern at Assembly Co in Manchester, NH May 2015 - September 2015, May 2016 - August 2016
job.job_summary: HelpedMy understanding is that these summary elements should start with action verbs that indicate your responsibility to enable quick reading for skills/experience; for example, "Devloped mobile applications for vaior companies (what kinds of companies) as a part of a team. make mobile applications for various companies in the Manchester, New Hampshire area. PrimarilyAgain, a better version of this summary would begin with the verb indicating your responsibilties/skills "Refactored and programmed (what? applications?) focused on program refactoring and debugging. Contributed to the development of three applications that are still used by businesses in the area today. Two applications implemented group messaging and planning, allowing employees within a company to communicate and organize more efficiently. Helped build an application for Williamson's Finances to connect its customers to their information at any time.these should be broken up into separate job_summary elements (as I reminded your group in email)

Northeastern University Class of 2020, Computer Science B.S.

report.p: This is a decent start, but check my inline comments for areas where the language can be improved (jb_summary section). Based on your use of the schema here, I'm not sure you fully understood your group's design (see notes above for specific instances). The main issue is the lack of headers and single job_summary element make the format of the rendered version difficult to read, an important aspect of the resume genre is ease of quick reading and clear demarcation of information. I could also imagine having more "additional information" since your other experience is limited--clubs? software experience? Etc.
